name: Digital & Core Tech
description: The foundation of the digital world, encompassing software development, infrastructure, and emerging technologies.

subRoles.name: Software Engineer
subRoles.shortDescription: Designs, develops, and maintains software applications and systems.
subRoles.longDescription: Software engineers create the programs and applications that run on computers and other devices. They work with programming languages like Python, Java, JavaScript, and C++ to build everything from mobile apps to enterprise systems.
subRoles.potential: High growth field with opportunities in every industry. Remote work possibilities and strong earning potential.

education.minimum: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field
education.preferred: Master's degree in Computer Science or Engineering

subRoles.name: Mobile & Game Developer
subRoles.shortDescription: Creates applications and games for mobile devices and gaming platforms.
subRoles.longDescription: Mobile and game developers design and build interactive experiences for smartphones, tablets, and gaming consoles. They work with specialized frameworks and engines to create engaging user experiences.
subRoles.potential: Creative field with opportunities in entertainment, education, and enterprise applications.

education.minimum: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Game Design, or related

subRoles.name: DevOps / SRE / Cloud Architect
subRoles.shortDescription: Ensures seamless software deployment and system reliability at scale.
subRoles.longDescription: DevOps engineers, Site Reliability Engineers (SREs), and Cloud Architects work to automate and streamline the software development lifecycle. They build infrastructure as code, monitor system performance, and ensure applications are scalable and resilient.

subRoles.name: Cyber-Security Specialist
subRoles.shortDescription: Protects digital assets and defends against cyber threats.
subRoles.longDescription: Cybersecurity specialists safeguard computer networks and systems from cyber attacks. They implement security measures, monitor for intrusions, and respond to security breaches to protect sensitive data and maintain system integrity.

subRoles.name: Network Architect / Engineer
subRoles.shortDescription: Designs and maintains computer networks for optimal performance.
subRoles.longDescription: Network architects design and build data communication networks, including local area networks (LANs), wide area networks (WANs), and intranets. They evaluate network needs, recommend solutions, and ensure networks operate efficiently and securely.

subRoles.name: Tech Sales Engineer / Support
subRoles.shortDescription: Bridges technical expertise with customer needs in sales and support.
subRoles.longDescription: Technical sales engineers and support specialists combine technical knowledge with sales or customer service skills. They help customers understand technical products, troubleshoot issues, and provide solutions that meet specific business requirements.

subRoles.name: Freelance / Gig Developer
subRoles.shortDescription: Works independently on diverse projects with flexible arrangements.
subRoles.longDescription: Freelance and gig developers work on a project basis for various clients. They enjoy the flexibility of choosing projects, setting rates, and working remotely while building a diverse portfolio of technical skills and industry experience.

subRoles.name: Government IT Roles
subRoles.shortDescription: Supports public sector digital transformation and e-governance initiatives.
subRoles.longDescription: Government IT professionals work on digital initiatives for public services, including e-governance platforms, citizen portals, and digital infrastructure. They contribute to national digital transformation while enjoying job stability and benefits.
